line_1: When this shall your Reason convince
line_2: How vainly you lavish your Sense.

line_1: Injoyn me any thing that may convince
line_2: Of my Flames Durance, and its Innosence,

line_1: Tis Boyle, not thee, that must the World convince;
line_2: But stop my Pen, blush at thy weak pretence,

line_1: Tis Boyle, not thee, that must the World convince;
line_2: Boyle the great Champion of Providence.

line_1: And told such lies, all to convince
line_2: The brain of our distemper'd prince;
